title: How to Make Gingersnap Pumpkin Cake

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 176 degrees Celsius.
Grease and flour a ten inch tubed pan.
steps.description: Make sure you grease well or the cake will stick to the pan. Do not skip flouring the pan as it helps the cake to rise and cut easily.

steps.headline: In a large bowl blend the pumpkin, eggs, sugar, and oil until well blended and the mixture resembles pumpkin goo.
In another bowl whisk the flour, baking soda,  pumpkin pie spice, and salt until dry ingredients are all mixed up.
Add your dry mixture to your wet pumpkin mixture.
steps.description: Blend until the ingredients are mixed nicely and look like pumpkin batter.

steps.headline: Transfer batter on tubed pan.
steps.description: If necessary, scrape any left-over batter using a spoon.

steps.headline: Bake 50-65 minutes depending on the type of oven you have.
steps.description: To test if it's ready, poke a toothpick or fork in the center of the cake. If it comes out clean with no batter on it, it's ready!

steps.headline: Take cake out of oven and let cool for 15-20 minutes on a wire rack.

parts.name: Making the Icing and Topping Off the Cake

steps.headline: In a small bowl, blend cream cheese, butter, and vanilla until mixed well and looks creamy.
steps.description: Slowly add in your sugar and blend again.

steps.headline: Once icing is smooth, use a large butter knife to spread on your pumpkin cake.
Top off your cake with crushed gingersnap cookies.
Use a knife to slowly cut your cake in a piece, Serve on a glass plate.

text: Making the Cake Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 176 degrees Celsius.  Grease and flour a ten inch tubed pan. Make sure you grease well or the cake will stick to the pan. Do not skip flouring the pan as it helps the cake to rise and cut easily. In a large bowl blend the pumpkin, eggs, sugar, and oil until well blended and the mixture resembles pumpkin goo. Place the bowl aside. In another bowl whisk the flour, baking soda,  pumpkin pie spice, and salt until dry ingredients are all mixed up.  Add your dry mixture to your wet pumpkin mixture. Blend until the ingredients are mixed nicely and look like pumpkin batter. Transfer batter on tubed pan. If necessary, scrape any left-over batter using a spoon. Bake 50-65 minutes depending on the type of oven you have. To test if it's ready, poke a toothpick or fork in the center of the cake. If it comes out clean with no batter on it, it's ready! Take cake out of oven and let cool for 15-20 minutes on a wire rack.  Making the Icing and Topping Off the Cake In a small bowl, blend cream cheese, butter, and vanilla until mixed well and looks creamy. Slowly add in your sugar and blend again. Once icing is smooth, use a large butter knife to spread on your pumpkin cake.  Top off your cake with crushed gingersnap cookies.  Use a knife to slowly cut your cake in a piece, Serve on a glass plate.  Enjoy your gingersnap pumpkin cake!
